Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw and label a fish, showing its parts clearly, such as fins, tail, and gills.
The student can draw and label water as the habitat where fish live.
The student can illustrate and label important needs of the fish, such as food sources, using simple drawings like small insects or other fish.
The student can show the relationship between the fish and its habitat, demonstrating some understanding of how the environment supports the fish.
CANNOT: The student may inconsistently label other elements in the fish's habitat, like plants and rocks, sometimes omitting them or labeling them incorrectly.
The student might not fully illustrate how all the different parts of the fish's habitat work together to support life, possibly missing subtler interactions.
